Brief Description of Work to be carried out: Refer to other permits such as Hot Work where applicable.
The maximum potential fall distance in metres (including depth of nearby excavations etc):
Chemicals - Solvents, paints etc. being used for cleaning or for work being done
Operation of moving equipment - Being struck by, pinched or entangled in moving parts
Foundation / Surfaces - Slope, stability, texture, cavities, water flow
Fatigue - Duration of task, physical demands, temperature, time of day
Falling Objects - Tools or materials falling from elevated equipment or elevated position
Hot surfaces - Scalding caused by external heating systems not being isolated
Radiation - Sun exposure, radiation gauges, electromagnetic fields
Manual Handling - Excessive climbing, reaching, carrying tools in belts or bags
Falls, slips and trips - Fluids left on floors, cables, pipes, tools, materials etc
Inadequate lighting - Due to weather, time of day or location
Obstructed access to work platform - Design, housekeeping, other workers
Vehicles - Mobile plant, site vehicles, public vehicles

This Hot Work Permit must be completed for Hot Work conducted in locations prior to works commencing, other than designated Hot Work areas/ workshops.
Use this form to apply for a Hot Work Permit as required by the DG-ZH-ST041 Hot Work Standard.
Hot work is a mandatory two-person task.
Description of hot work to be carried out:
Description of tools to be used:
Where a hazard has been identified by marking “PASS” below, record the hazard in your SWMS (or equivalent) and nominate the appropriate controls. A SWMS (or equivalent) is required for all hot work.
Contaminants - Solids, liquids, sludge, gases, vapours, fumes or particulates.
Chemicals - Solvents, paints etc. being used for cleaning or for work being done.
Flammables or combustibles - Oxy-acetylene hose leaks, fuel spills from vehicles, LPG bottles, incorrect isolation of pipes etc.
Operation of plant and equipment - Sparks created by high speed cutting, hot exhaust etc.
Uncontrolled introduction of steam, water, other gas/ liquid - Incorrect isolation of pipes, ducts, drains and vents.
Electricity - Welders, tools and equipment used in hazardous area.
Electricity - Welders, tools and equipment used in hazardous area.
Explosion or fire - Flammables or combustibles within the 15m radius hot work area.
Extremes of temperature - Caused by the work process or the weather conditions, or where appropriate ventilation is not provided.
Falls, trips and slips - Inadequate access, poor housekeeping obstructing walkways.
Inadequate lighting - Non-intrinsically safe temporary lighting in a hazardous area.
Vehicles/ combustion engines - Being operated within hazardous area.
Vegetation/ flora - Leaf litter, twigs/ branches/ grasses and other combustible vegetative matter.
Steps taken to eliminate / control flammable materials within 15 m of area where hot work will be done
